revisions.rev:
This is a '''list of current motifs on the [[banknotes]]''' of different countries. The customary design of [[banknote]]s in most countries is a portrait of a notable citizen on the front (or ''[[obverse]]'') and a different motif on the back (or ''reverse'') - often something relating to that person. One exception to this is the [[euro banknotes]], where non-existent architectural structures have been chosen to avoid the impression of a national bias. Even though most banknotes have more than one motif on each side, only the main motifs are described here. ==Argentina== The official currency of [[Argentina]] is the [[Argentine peso]] ('''ARS'''). The motifs used are: {| class="wikitable" |- " ! Denomination || Obverse || Reverse |- |'''ARS 1''' || [[Carlos Pellegrini]]
(not currently in use, replaced by the 1 peso [[coin]])|| [[Argentine National Congress]] |- |'''ARS 2''' || [[BartolomÃ© Mitre]] || Mitre Museum |- |'''ARS 5''' || [[JosÃ© de San MartÃ­n]] || Cerro de la Gloria, [[Mendoza Province|Mendoza]] |- |'''ARS 10''' || [[Manuel Belgrano]] || [[National Flag Memorial (Argentina)|National Flag Memorial]] |- |'''ARS 20''' || [[Juan Manuel de Rosas]] || [[Battle of Vuelta de Obligado]] |- |'''ARS 50''' || [[Domingo Faustino Sarmiento]] || [[Casa Rosada|Casa de Gobierno]] |- |'''ARS 100''' || [[Julio Argentino Roca]] || [[CampaÃ±a del Desierto]] |} ==Australia== The official currency of Australia is the [[Australian dollar]] ('''AUD'''). The motifs used are: {| class="wikitable" |- " ! Denomination || Obverse || Reverse |- |'''AUD 5''' ||[[Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom|Queen Elizabeth II]] || [[Parliament of Australia|Parliament House]] |- |'''AUD 5''' || [[Henry Parkes]] || [[Catherine Helen Spence]] (Centenary of Federation commemorative note) |- |'''AUD 10''' || [[Banjo Paterson|A. B. 'Banjo' Paterson]] || [[Mary Gilmore]] |- |'''AUD 20''' || [[Mary Reibey]] || [[John Flynn (minister)|John Flynn]] |- |'''AUD 50''' || [[David Unaipon]] || [[Edith Cowan]] |- |'''AUD 100''' || [[Dame Nellie Melba]] || [[Sir John Monash]] |} ==Brazil== [[File:100real 2.jpg|thumb|right|350px|Obverse of a 100 Brazilian real banknote]] The official currency of Brazil is the [[Brazilian real]] ('''BRL'''). Denomination || Obverse |- |'''PEN 10''' || [[JosÃ© Abelardo QuiÃ±ones GonzÃ¡les]] |- |'''PEN 20''' || [[RaÃºl Porras Barrenechea]] |- |'''PEN 50''' || [[Abraham Valdelomar|Abraham Valdelomar Pinto]] |- |'''PEN 100''' || [[Jorge Basadre|Jorge Basadre Grohmann]] |- |'''PEN 200''' || [[Saint Rose of Lima]] |} ==Philippines== The official currency of the [[Philippines]] is the [[Philippine peso]] ('''PHP'''). A musician's piano at centre right. |- |'''RON 10''' || [[Nicolae Grigorescu]] (1838–1907, [[Hollyhock]] flower, an artist's palette and paintbrush || Nicolae Grigorescu's painting "[[Rodica]]" |- |'''RON 50''' || [[Aurel Vlaicu]] (1882–1913), A mountain flower [[edelweiss]], an aircraft propeller, [[Coat of arms of Romania]] at top left || [[Mountain eagle]] head, "[[Vlaicu II]]" aircraft design and "[[Gnome]]" engine sketch |- |'''RON 100''' || [[Ion Luca Caragiale]] (1852–1912), Comedy masks and a violet flower || Old building of the [[Bucharest National Theatre]], [[Statue of Ion Luca Caragiale (Bucharest)|Caragiale's statue]] at left |- |'''RON 200''' || [[Lucian Blaga]] (1895–1961), [[Coat of arms of Romania]] at top left, [[Papaver rhoeas|poppies]] || A [[watermill]] and the [[Hamangia culture|Hamangia Thinker]] |- |'''RON 500''' || [[Mihai Eminescu]] (1850–1889), Lime tree [[blossom]]s, a quill and an inkpot || [[Timpul]] newspaper, University Library in [[IaÅi]] |} ==Russia== [[File:Banknote 1000 rubles 2004 front.jpg|thumb|right|350px|Obverse of a 1000 Russian ruble banknote]] The official currency of Russia is the [[Russian ruble]] ('''RUB'''). Denomination || Obverse || Description || Reverse |- |'''UAH 1''' || [[Vladimir the Great|Volodymyr the Great]] || First Christian ruler || [[Kiev]] (''Kyiv'') in the time of [[Kievan Rus']] |- |'''UAH 2''' || [[Yaroslav the Wise]] || Prince of [[Kievan Rus']]|| [[Saint Sophia Cathedral in Kiev]] |- |'''UAH 5''' || [[Bohdan Khmelnytskyi]] || Father of the nation || A [[Church (building)|church]] in [[Subotiv]] |- |'''UAH 10''' || [[Ivan Mazepa]] || National hero || [[Kiev Pechersk Lavra|Cave Monastery]] in [[Kiev]] |- |'''UAH 20''' || [[Ivan Franko]] || Writer and thinker || [[Lviv Opera and Ballet Theater|Opera house]] in [[Lviv]] |- |'''UAH 50''' || [[Mykhailo Hrushevsky]] || Historian and statesman || [[Verkhovna Rada building|Parliament building]] in [[Kiev|Kyiv]] |- |'''UAH 100''' || [[Taras Shevchenko]] || Writer, artist, founder of modern written [[Ukrainian language]] || [[Dnieper]] |- |'''UAH 200''' || [[Lesya Ukrainka]] || Writer || Fortress in [[Lutsk]] |- |'''UAH 500''' || [[Hryhoriy Skovoroda]] || Philosopher and composer || [[National University of Kyiv-Mohyla Academy|Mohyla Academy]] in [[Kiev]] |} ==The United Kingdom== The currency of the UK is the pound sterling, represented by the symbol Â£. The [[Bank of England]] is the central bank, responsible for issuing currency. Banks in Scotland and Northern Ireland retain the right to issue their own notes, subject to retaining enough Bank of England notes in reserve to cover the issue. ===England=== The official currency of England is the [[pound sterling]] ('''GBP'''). The motifs used are: {| class="wikitable" |- " ! Denomination || Obverse || Reverse || Description |- |'''GBP 5''' || [[Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom|Queen Elizabeth II]] || [[Elizabeth Fry]] || Social reformer |- |'''GBP 10''' || Queen Elizabeth II || [[Charles Darwin]] || Scientist |- |'''GBP 20 (Series E (2000))''' || Queen Elizabeth II || [[Edward Elgar]] || Composer |- |'''GBP 20 (Series F (2007))''' || Queen Elizabeth II || [[Adam Smith]] || Economist |- |'''GBP 50''' || Queen Elizabeth II || [[John Houblon]] || First Governor of the Bank of England |- |'''New Style GBP 50''' || Queen Elizabeth II || [[James Watt]] and [[Matthew Boulton]] || Industrial Engenieers |} ===Scotland=== The official currency of [[Scotland]] is the [[Pound sterling]] ('''GBP'''). Under Scottish legislation, banknotes are issued by commercial banks not the government. The motifs issued by the [[Bank of Scotland]] are: {| class="wikitable" |- " ! Denomination || Obverse || Reverse |- |'''GBP 5''' (Tercentenary series (1995)) || Sir [[Walter Scott]] || [[Vignetting|vignette]] of [[oil]] and [[energy]] |- |'''GBP 5''' (Bridges series (2007)) || Sir Walter Scott || [[Brig o' Doon]] |- |'''GBP 10''' (Tercentenary series (1995)) || Sir Walter Scott || vignette of [[distilling]] and [[brewing]] |- |'''GBP 10''' (Bridges series (2007)) || Sir Walter Scott || [[Glenfinnan Viaduct]] |- |'''GBP 20''' (Tercentenary series (1995)) || Sir Walter Scott || vignette of [[education]] and [[research]] |- |'''GBP 20''' (Bridges series (2007)) || Sir Walter Scott || [[Forth Railway Bridge|Forth Bridge]] |- |'''GBP 50''' (Tercentenary series (1995)) || Sir Walter Scott || vignette of [[arts]] and [[culture]] |- |'''GBP 50''' (Bridges series (2007)) || Sir Walter Scott || [[Falkirk Wheel]] |- |'''GBP 100''' (Tercentenary series (1995)) || Sir Walter Scott || vignette of [[leisure]] and [[tourism]] |- |'''GBP 100''' (Bridges series (2007)) || Sir Walter Scott || [[Kessock Bridge]] |} The [[Royal Bank of Scotland]] issues: {| class="wikitable" |- " !
